title: “ only beverage offers”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | A lot of Junior Crew operating this full flight SQ128(10/28/2025). PTV still display the old safety video version. Multiple times trying the KrisWorld wifi connectivity, it doesn’t work and can’t pair the SQ mobile apps. No earpiece provided and since this is a short flight drinks are the only beverage offers. What surprised me is this is unusual experience without landing announcements made with long taxi to arrival gate. Chat with the Crew while disembarked and they acknowledged and laughing say they forgot.

title: "lost my luggage"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I’ve always considered Singapore Airlines one of the world’s leading carriers, but a recent experience has been profoundly disappointing. It has now been over 44 days since the airline lost my luggage, and I have yet to receive a proper response, follow-up, or a meaningful update. I’ve been met with vague, templated replies and no accountability. Each department passes the issue along, but no one resolves it.

title: “no available overhead"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ177. Booked in February. Checked in online 48 hours prior to flight. However showed up at the counter, and given a new seat. I tried to inquire why, but Agent didn’t speak English. Aboard Couldn’t have my personal effects, and no available overhead. Felt pretty terrible. Crew not willing to assist. SQ Regional not recommended.

title: "weighing it, declared it overweight"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | This was the worst business-class flight I’ve taken. On the JFK–Singapore–Bangkok route, staff fixated on my carry-on — a Briggs & Riley bag. They insisted on weighing it, declared it overweight, and forced me to buy a replacement carry-on for $156.99 just to board. This same carry-on has flown on every airline I’ve used. The seat was another nightmare. Whoever designed that leg rest clearly never tried sleeping in it. It’s a minor complaint compared with the carry-on fiasco, but it shows how little thought went into this so-called premium experience. The SilverKris Lounge at Terminal 3 in Singapore was unimpressive, and the one in Terminal 2 was a joke.

title: “on the ground disaster, In the Air Gold!”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ186 SIN-SGN. SQ SIN Ground staff a disaster, just barely displaying connecting flights. No escort, no verification, and no radio calls to hold the gates, like before the Virus. Multiple passengers had T2 Onward Connections. Barely Arrived at Gate with friendly security. Once in, boarding commenced. Crew energetic, and polite. Still haven’t seen new safety video, yet had 3 flights with SQ in 5 days span. Took off, and served a meal. Multiple drink rounds performed, and arrived into SGN. Air Traffic Control Ground must have forgot about us, as it took 10+ minutes to moor at the gate. Captain did make an apology announcement, about it too. After 53 Minutes, cleared Immigration, and couldn’t find the luggage carousel. No SQ agents in sight. SQ on the ground disaster, In the Air Gold!

title: "the crew was attentive and visible"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ325 FRA-SIN in Premium Economy. Check in opened early, with polite associate. Initially didn’t know how to read my Visa, for onward flight. Checked me in, and I proceeded to Security. Staff was walking around by the gate checking travel documents. Orderly Boarding commenced. Crew warm, and friendly. A380 Premium Economy seat comfortable. Pushed back late, and took off. Had the first meal, with multiple drink rounds. Throughout the flight crew was attentive, and visible. Second meal served. Arrived into Changi 25+ minutes late, with the aircraft parked quite a distance from the T3 Center.

title: “food was rubbish”
body: Not Verified |    While the cabin crew service was ok my food was rubbish. The first meal was a late dinner and the option I chose was not available on the meal trolley the crew member said she would get it from the galley kitchen and deliver it to me. This never happened. The next meal was breakfast. Both choices for this were terrible. Singapore Airlines is rated as one of the best, but this was certainly not the case on this flight.

title: “didn’t receive a Welcome greeting”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ25 JFK-FRA in Premium Economy. Check in opened early. Had a massive line, but staff were efficient and polite. JFK had a new security style. While boarding crew read my pass wrong, and seated me in Business. I didn’t receive a Welcome Aboard greeting. IFE still doesn’t have Old is Gold section. Round of Champagne came out, followed by dinner. No second round of drinks. Slept through breakfast, and 60 minutes out of FRA. No trash collected, and had to go to the galley to throw my trash. Arrived, and SQ agent announcements were inaudible. Upon getting to Baggage Claim, My Rimowa had its tag removed. Not sure how it arrived in FRA.

title: "they offered no compensation"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Their online customer service was horrible, and appears to be run by AI robots who sympathise, but don’t actually help at all. I booked 9 months ahead for my NZ-UK trip so that I got a nice cheap flight with short stopovers. 1.5 months out, Singapore airlines decided to cancel my middle flight, with no explanation as to why. I said ok book me on a new flight, they pointed fingers at the booking agent to fix it. And the booking agent told me there was a technical error on Singapore Air’s system, so they couldn’t do it for me. Both of them pointed fingers blaming the other one for a whole month. So I didn’t have a confirmed flight for over a month while I was just left waiting. Singapore airlines were the ones to finally fix it, but only when I threatened legal action at them. This was after a month of stress and calling both the booking agent and Singapore every day! They then rebooked me onto a much much longer flight that had huge stopovers, meaning I had to fork out for nights accommodation myself in Melbourne, and add an extra day to my travel, and the level of stress I faced was insane. And they offered no compensation for this. I had to fork out $168.80 for their mess up in accommodation, and the extra food. And they refuse to offer any form of compensation. I’ve asked repeatedly, and they say they can’t do anything. My in person service was lovely and can’t fault it. But their online team are honestly useless. All they say is “we understand your frustration, but can’t do anything”.

title: "luggage was left in Singapore"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I traveled from Australia to Madrid via Singapore on August 28 with a shared flight operated by Singapore Airlines and Air Europa. Due to a delay, my luggage was left in Singapore. It’s now day 8 and I still haven’t received it. Singapore Airlines blames Air Europa. Air Europa is disorganized and offers no real customer service. No updates, no plan, no accountability.

title: "A disappointing airline"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I flew yesterday from Singapore to Bangkok at around lunch time. The Aircraft was configured in a 3-3-3 pattern to have a total of 301 Seats in Economy Class. The problem was that for such a large Economy Class configuration , SIA provided only 6 toilets. Further the toilets were cramped, gloomy with barely any lighting. The Aircraft was clean - no more Newspapers, Economic Times Magazine , or Airline Mag. The Seats were comfortable. Audio device was provided a ear plugs. I had ordered AVML (Indian Veg Meal) & this came in 2 cardboard boxes. (One had some paneer curry with carrots on top & basamati rice biryani plain rice at the bottom luke warm) A half parotta (indian bread was provided with plain yougurt & sweet lime pickle. The other box had 3 small Rasmalia pieces in a sugary syrup. Drinks were served in paper cups & cutlery was wooden spoon & forks. My food was insipid bland & tasteless. The plane was about 75-80 % full and landed on time at Suvarnabhumi Airport. Baggage came undamaged in Bangkok. A disappointing airline

title: “Seats had generous pitch”
body: ✅ Trip Verified |    My connection in Changi was just over an hour, which meant power-walking through Terminal 3 like I was in a fitness ad, but I even managed to window-shop before heading to the gate. Boarding the A380 was the highlight, my first time on the superjumbo, and honestly I get the hype. Quiet, smooth, roomy, and with pillows and blankets already waiting on the seat, it felt like flying in a moving library. Turbulence near Taipei thanks to a hurricane reminded me we were still in the air, but otherwise it was ridiculously comfortable. Seats had generous pitch, adjustable (if slightly stiff) headrests, proper tray table design, cup holders, USB ports, and power outlets. The IFE had a bigger screen than the short-haul jets, and it was slick to use. WiFi was patchy, but that is more politics than technology when flying over certain countries. Meal was chicken egg noodles in honor of SG60, tasty enough to not need extra seasoning. Toilets definitely showed their age, but the crew were absolute stars, friendly and attentive. Bonus points for baggage arriving in Shanghai without drama, plus app tracking so I did not have to play “Will my bag make it?” roulette. If the A380 is a dying breed, I am glad I caught it while it still shines.

title: “Comfortable seat, friendly crew”
body: ✅ Trip Verified |    An early morning flight usually means I am running on coffee fumes, but this one was smooth enough to feel like a gentle wake-up call. Check-in still required going to the counter (seriously, it is 2025… just let me generate the boarding pass on the app already), but at least the staff were efficient. Once onboard, the shiny A350 felt like a treat. Comfortable seat, friendly crew, pillows already waiting, and an inflight entertainment screen that actually worked quickly without lagging like an old smartphone. No tail camera, which was a pity, but the movie selection was solid. WiFi was complimentary for KrisFlyer members, though only good for messaging, so no video calls to brag midair. Power outlets and USB charging were available, meaning my phone landed happier than I did. The “snack” turned out to be a proper hot meal: a delicious bowl of mie ayam, filling to both stomach and soul. Arrival into Terminal 3 made the connection an easy stroll. A great start to the day, even if technology still refuses to replace the check-in counter.

title: “fan of this aircraft”
body: ✅ Trip Verified |    The final leg felt like a nice epilogue to the trip. Another A350, and I am quickly becoming a fan of this aircraft. I had a window seat, which always feels like a win, and once again pillows and blankets were already placed on each seat. The plane looked like a long-haul setup, with a different business class cabin and even premium economy tucked in, so it felt a little more “fancy” than your usual short hop. Power outlet under the seat, responsive IFE system, all the essentials in place. This time, instead of movies, I scrolled through the audio section and let nature sounds help me nap, because why not listen to waves crashing while you are 30,000 feet above the Java Sea. Breakfast options were fried carrot cake or omelet, and I went with the omelet and apple juice, simple and satisfying after a long night of travel. The crew were, as always, attentive without being overbearing. Best of all, no disruptive passengers in sight. A short, calm, and restful way to close the journey, and proof that not every flight story needs drama.

title: “not bad at all”
body: ✅ Trip Verified |    Dropping off baggage at Pudong station there were counters open, long line, lots of sighing, but at least the ground staff were polite. The red-eye back was on a 787-10, another first for me, and I liked the layout. Proper seat pockets instead of flimsy nets, USB and power at each seat, pillows and blankets already waiting, and an IFE system that actually responded when you tapped it. I barely used it though, since I was more focused on sleep. Dinner was twice-cooked pork, a little bland but improved with a glass of white wine. Toilets were conveniently mid-cabin, which helped since I was half-asleep most of the flight. The crew handled everything gracefully, including a fellow passenger who ordered a bland meal then complained it was not vegetarian, and spent the rest of the flight blinding people with their flashlight. Not the crew’s fault, but I had secondhand embarrassment on their behalf. Arrival in Singapore was smooth, and I even had time for shopping and a quick stop before security. For a red-eye, this one was not bad at all, flashlight warriors aside.

title: “ complaint requesting compensation”
body: ✅ Trip Verified |    In response to the delayed departure of Scoot’s flight in Bangkok, which resulted in a more than three-hour delay and the subsequent missed connection to Johannesburg, I was rerouted to Amsterdam (economy plus) and then I was put on a KLM flight to Cape Town (economy only). I lodged a formal complaint requesting compensation. However, my request was met with a simple letter expressing gratitude for my patience. I find that this is inacceptable as they could have put me on a later flight from SIN to JNB/CPT saving me the additional 11 hours flight and the transit time in Amsterdam. While I am disappointed with the inadequate response, I must acknowledge that the economy premium offered by Singapore Airlines was satisfactory. In my opinion, their economy premiumis superior to comparable options provided by other airlines, as the seats are significantly more comfortable. The food quality was acceptable, although the wine selection was limited. Service was standard, nothing to write home about but the entertainment options on Singapore Airlines were highly enjoyable. Given the horrendous connection offered and the equally unsatisfying response, I will not fly SQ again

title: “missed my connection”
body: ✅ Trip Verified |    I flew from SYD to the UK and return in May 2025. The LGW to SIN flight was delayed and I missed my connection to SYD. I was put on a later flight and downgraded to economy. I accept delays happen but I do not accept that Singapore Airlines take 3 months to make a simple fare adjustment and refund to me. I paid $5822.00 for this flight on 8 November 2024 - the fare adjustment/refund of $229.00 for the SIN to SYD sector is disproportionate and an insult. The service to me on board was shoddy and my food was poor. A year earlier I flew SYD/LHR/SYD on JAL - a vastly superior experience.

title: "served in a plastic cup"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I’ve always admired Singapore Airlines for its attention to detail and exceptional service, which is why I booked them for my recent flight from San Francisco to Singapore in Premium economy. I was quite surprised when I ordered a whiskey and it was served in a plastic cup. For the price of the ticket, I expected proper glasswar. It might seem like a small detail, but these details are what truly define a premium travel experience. Everything else about the journey — the professionalism of the crew, the comfort of the cabin, and the on-time performance — met the high standards I’ve come to expect. But this one detail felt inconsistent with the Singapore Airlines experience I’ve always valued.

title: "standard has dropped"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | The cabin service and food served to me on this flight was horrendous. Cabin crew service no longer had the warmth that they used to be known for. Singapore Airlines' standard has dropped drastically.

title: “Staff polite and courteous”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ177 in Economy. Check in at SGN fast. Staff polite, and courteous. They acknowledged I checked in Online, checked my Bag through, instructed me to watch my Bag go through security, and thanked me. Proceed to the gate. We had a Gate Change, and the announcement was clear. However when boarding commenced, Announcements were not clear, and extremely difficult. Volume was low, or speakers were out of service. Boarded, with a friendly, warm crew welcoming us aboard. Overhead storage not available, so had to use 3 rows ahead of me. Pushed back, and got on the Runway. Seem to sit for a while, ready for take. Took off, and right into Turbulence, so limited services. Eventually served a Meal, and Drink. I had the Fish, and Potatoes. As the Captain announced descend, Crew expeditiously coming around to collect Trays, and Trash. Smooth landing, and arrived into Changi T3, with the friendly crew wishing me well.

title: "experience was very positive"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Bangkok to Rome with stop in Singapore with wife and infant (almost 2 years old). Overall the experience was very positive. You can choose seat and meal option at booking time, so you won't have to worry about it before your journey. We chose the seats with bassinet support, which are spacious. They delivered food earlier for us, and they have proper infant meal which includes milk and a solid option. + Entertainment options are decent. They also provided a gift to the baby and free stroller delivery. Overall I would retake this airline without a doubt.

title: “Not worth the money”
body: Not Verified | Flight delayed with technical fault meaning missed connector to London. Seat in Premium Economy was also broken with token voucher offered. Seats are old and very unsupportive and still cramped for me and I’m not even 6ft. Not worth the money.

title: "would fly them again to Australia"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | ADL-SIN, on Boeing 787-10. ADL check in was chaotic. Lots of people standing around, not flying with SQ, getting in the way. Upon getting to the automated machine, SQ agent appeared. I explained to him, I’m going to a Visa required country. He listened, and excused himself to process my ticket. Upon coming back, he thanked me for waiting, and assisted me tagging my bag. I then dropped it off, and proceed to Immigration. Boarding was done professionally. Upon boarding, friendly crew member assisted me with my Carry On. Took off on time. Cabin crew professional, but nothing special. They dimmed the lights so we could sleep, and I managed to doze off for over 2 hours. SQ has a fixed back seat, but unlike the A380, much more comfortable. Landed Changi T3, and received friendly onward well wishes from the crew. Have taken SQ 4x to Australia, and would fly them again to Australia.

title: “should bear the responsibility”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My flight from Singapore to Denpasar (DPS) was cancelled due to a volcanic eruption. While I understand that such events are extraordinary circumstances, several other international airlines continued their operations to Bali on the same day. Singapore Airlines decision to cancel the flight, while other carriers deemed it safe to fly, appears to be a subjective one. Singapore Airlines should bear the responsibility for the financial losses I incurred, including the non-refundable costs for my pre-booked hotel and activities in Bali, which were forfeited. However, it refused to do so. On top of that, the lack of timely and adequate communication from Singapore Airlines is appalling. I was only informed of the flight cancellation after arriving in Singapore for my transit. Had I been notified while still in Tokyo, I could have remained there or explored alternative travel arrangements with other airlines. Instead, I was stranded in a transit city with no prior warning and extremely limited options. As a direct result, I was forced to secure and pay for my own lodging in Singapore. To make matters worse, upon the arrival in Singapore, I was met with a chaotic and disorganized baggage claim process, resulting in a 12 hour wait for my luggage. Singapore airline offered no assistance whatsoever in arranging overnight accommodation and I was left to fend for myself. After I filed a complaint to Singapore Airline, I got a email asking about my lost luggage in Bali instead of addressing the issues that I mentioned above. The funny thing is, my luggage was delayed in Singapore, not in Bali. Their staff has not only failed to identify the issue, but also outsourced their customer support complaints to a different team instead of contacting me directly. Singapore Airlines is consistently ranked among the world's top airlines, a reputation that suggests a commitment to exceptional customer service. My recent experience, however, paints a starkly different picture – one of operational disarray, poor communication, and a disregard for passenger welfare.

title: "was greeted at my seat"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Less than 2 Hours to board, flight appeared on the Information Screens. Security at Changi quick, and professional. Announcements were made, however they were inaudible, and I didn’t know what was happening. Apparently aircraft arrived late from BKK. Boarding commenced, in an orderly fashion. Aboard only greeted at the entry. Walked through the aircraft and was greeted at my seat. First time on the Boeing 787-10. Seat was fixed back, but comfortable. Pushed back, and headed out. They kept the lights full blast, and couldn’t sleep. We got served a snack, and then they dimmed the lights. Took forever to fall asleep. Woke up to a meal being served. Multiple rounds of coffee served, and felt adjusted. Landed at ADL, with SQ Staff not visible, to help find the luggage carousel.

title: "in the air still Gold Service"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Booked in January, and no solo seat available. Received information from SQ, that flight time was going to be early, due to a Heatwave on US. Coast. Arrived at check in, and agent wouldn’t check my Bag, or issue ticket for final destination. I was stumped as I had done the exact same thing, on the exact same route before. After going back and forth, she transferred me to a manager, however again he would not check me, and my bag, to my onward destination. Upon passing Security, I ran into the Head SQ Agent, and complained to her. She listened, took note of me, via my Boarding Pass, and politely told me she was going to look into it. After 60 minutes she came back, with my Luggage checked in to my onward destination, and told me I would be issued a ticket as well. Onboard crew friendly, warm, and welcoming. Took off on time, yet throughout the flight Turbulence affected all services. For Lunch they had an option, previously they haven’t. I had the Braised Chicken. Constant refills commenced, and attentive crew. IFE was a disaster, with nothing decent. Throughout the flight, drinks available, but unlike ANA no drink bar style, and you had to wait for the crew to serve you. Had the second meal, and again options, with excellent service. Arrived into a quiet Changi T3, and commenced layover. Since the Virus, SQ on the ground is a disaster, in the air still Gold Service.

title: "mediocre at best"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I flew in business class and it was mediocre at best. It did not seem like full flat seats, staff was inattentive to me, I had to ask for everything and my food was inedible.

title: "miles haven't been credited"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | As a KrisFlyer Elite Silver member, I made several bookings through KrisFlyer Vroom on November 10, 2024, and processed a refund on December 21, 2024. However, it's been nearly six months, and my miles (481,292) still haven't been credited to my account despite multiple follow-ups from the airline. This experience is disappointing, especially from an airline that claims to prioritize customer focus but appears unresponsive. The situation feels unfair and raises concerns about Singapore Airlines' reliability and trustworthiness, despite its reputation for quality service.

title: “Refused a bottle of water”
body: Not Verified | Refused a bottle of water in the beginning of the fight. SQ CS confirmed me that only FC Premium economy class can have a bottle of water. Economy class only being served a cup of water. When requested a Singapore sling and you cannot have a can of beer at the same time, what’s the point of buying a SQ ticket which is more expensive than other airlines and downgrade the inflight service. Hot towel has no perfume as it was in the past year 1993. SQ food is also not delicious from SIN to CDG flight, fried fish with maizena buttery - not delicious at all.

title: "seat was very comfortable"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   Check-in and baggage drop at Cape Town were very easy and smooth. The Bidvest Premier lounge was very comfortable, with a good selection of breakfast fare. On both legs of this journey boarding was efficient and the welcome very friendly. Onboard service could not be faulted. The seat was very comfortable in sitting position, with plenty of storage, but manually activating the flatbed and sleeping diagonally detracted a bit from the experience. The vegetarian food and drink were generally good, but on two occasions very dry and rubbery vegetable wraps were served. On the first flight passengers were required to remain seated while the aircraft was serviced during a 70-minute stop at Johannesburg. Both flights operated slightly early. During the lay-over in Singapore we had a very comfortable wait in the Silver Kris lounge, and then went quickly through security at the gate. Our luggage was delivered quickly (but the Melbourne Airport customs chaos was a different story).

title: "My sincere appreciation"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Singapore to Kolkata. My sincere appreciation to all the crew in the flight who were serving economy class. All the crew were very courteous from boarding to in flight service to de boarding. I am vegetarian and opted for vegetarian meal. Selection of array of dishes and there taste was delightful. Free in flight wifi is amazing.

title: "disappointing experience"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   I had a disappointing experience with Singapore Airlines during my recent trip from Delhi to Denpasar via Singapore. Despite requesting special assistance well in advance, confirming it through emails and at check-in, no assistance was provided at Changi Airport during the transit period. The staff later claimed that my assistance request was only recorded for the final arrival at Delhi, not for the transit at Singapore, which is when it was needed.

title: "lack of supervision on customer-service"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My flight of SQ from LHR-SIN, SIN-PEN + return leg was smooth and was treated with respectable service. However, the same cannot be said of their customer service online, both email and chatbox. Prior to my trip, I had problems activating my KrisFlyer account as it was idle/inactive for a few years. First contact to customer service was done on 18-Jan-2025. I was unable to login to my old account, and also unable create a new Krisflyer account using a new email address due to a system error. Despite following up on 22-Jan, 3-Feb, 7-Feb, there was no reply and there has been no reply to date; 08-May-2025 after almost 4.5 months. With disappointment of SQ's customer service and feeling unwelcomed, I did my booking of LHR-PEN with another airlines frequent miles program. However, the miles points were not credited although it was clearly written in my eticket. My attempt to claim the missing miles was complicated as I have not kept the boarding pass. My attempt to again reach SQ chat customer service was another disappointment. Both these encounters with customer service tells me that there is lack of supervision on customer-service ticketing conclusion and success rate. This is disappointing for an airline that is reputable for in-person service. The same level of detail needs to be done on online service.

title: "Very poor customer service"
body: Not Verified | Very poor customer service. On the outbound flight I was allowed to take a power bank but was told that the rules would change whilst I was away and I’d need permission to bring it back. I spent hours over the couple of weeks, trying to get this permission, which never came. The website contained no useful information to suggest that my powerbank was not allowed, customer services were slow to reply, and when they did the response came from a different person each time and did not answer my question, it was impossible to find an email address on the website, and it took me round in circles continuously. The online form could not be submitted from my phone (despite trying several times over several days, only sending when I eventually had a chance to get onto a laptop. Because of the slow and unhelpful responses, in the end I had to leave the power bank behind in Singapore. Since my return, the airline has been equally useless and has absolved itself of all responsibility. Exceptionally poor.

title: " there’s little room between each row"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | In October 2024 I flew with Singapore Airlines return from Sydney to Phnom Phen and the flights between Singapore and Cambodia were on their new 737-MAX 8. It was my first opportunity to experience their regional business class and from row 2 - their much talked about throne seat. Despite the flight time, Male is another destination in their regional network, only this time it was a 787-10 Dreamliner. Given this is a widebody aircraft, the business class seating is 1x2x1 with the single seats on either side staggered – the front row seat is against the aisle followed by a seat against the window. I usually pre-order my meals using their ‘book the cook’ service but forgot on this occasion. That proved to be a big mistake because what arrived was so underwhelming I can’t even remember what it was. But I know I tried it and then handed the tray and everything on it back to a flight attendant and chose to sleep instead. The seat converts into a lay flat bed which was quite comfortable given there’s no bedding provided other than a blanket and pillow. But the footwell is much more accommodating than the 737 throne seat. However, there’s little room between each row, so business class is tightly packed and on a full flight like mine the cabin is no a haven in the sky. Despite that, I managed to get about 2 hours of much needed sleep. Then on arrival, the rather expensive bottle of champagne I purchased on board was seized. I was unaware that you require a license to bring any alcohol into the country; even if it’s just 1 bottle. It would have been nice if the crew said something before, they processed the sale. Did the flight experience live up to my expectations? – I would have to say no. Sure the aircraft was fairly new, but then it’s hard to guess the age of their planes from the inside. I should rate this experience as 5 out of 10 because Singapore Airlines can do much better and usually do. But I’m feeling generous so I’ll give them 6

title: "found my seat area dirty"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I recently flew Business Class on SQ612 from Singapore to Incheon on 9 April 2025, and the experience fell short of what one would expect from a premium airline like Singapore Airlines. Upon boarding, I found my seat area dirty. I raised the issue and submitted photographic evidence, expecting it to be taken seriously. The initial response was a generic apology, and after pushing for escalation, I was offered a SGD100 KrisShop voucher, an insultingly small gesture. This isn’t just about cleanliness; it’s about how customer concerns are handled.

title: "one of the best airlines"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | There can be no doubt, Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines in the world. From the moment you step on board you are greeted a team of people and each one acknowledges you and you always see a smile. A flight attendant came and introduced herself to me saying she was responsible for taking care of me for this flight and to let her know if I there was anything I needed. I had taken advantage of their ‘book the cook’ service and chosen my meal in advance. But I couldn’t remember what it was I ordered, and was reassure if I changed my mind that wasn’t a problem I was free to choose anything for the flight menu. While the method of changing the chair to a bed on their 777 is unconventional, it’s damn comfortable and easy to get a few hours sleep. The pillows and bedding are a real treat. I find that Singapore Airlines flight attendants have an ability to match the level of service to an individual passenger’s needs. The bathrooms are always clean, and you can enter without fear of what might await you. I wish the airline would provide business class passengers with sleeper suits as other airlines do. On this, they are at a competitive disadvantage. I take my own (typically one from Qatar Airways) and it doesn’t do Singapore Airlines any good to have a passenger walking around in clothing blazoned with a competitor’s logo.

title: "terribly designed business class seat"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   London to Singapore business class on the A380-800. Marking this rating down due to a fatal flaw in the terribly designed business class seat which is truly awful if you want to try to sleep! While it’s a flat bed you are forced to sleep diagonally with very narrow footwells so that if yiu want to change position to lie on your side then your otherside it’s impossible! It’s to restrictive to move so you’ll hardly get any decent sleep unless you have consumed large amounts of alcohol from the great choice on the wine list…whoever designed this seat needs to be fired! Apparently talking to one flight attendant they did say there’s a refit of new seats & interior on this aircraft planned but wasn’t sure when. Cabin Crew were fabulous as you’d expect in serving our needs & was nice to engage in conversation with a couple of them which was very welcoming indeed. Food was superb & every dish we had was delicious & drink choices again excellent. Forget the WiFi as it’s doesn’t work so save your money & getting frustrated. IFE was good quick responsive touch screen & easy to navigate. Definitely recommend this airline but at this time avoid the A380-800 business class seat if you think you’ll get a good nights sleep & opt for there 350 or 777 aircraft.

title: "very mixed experience"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   Flew on SQ228; very mixed experience. The cabin crew were extremely good, and efficient. The food however was not up to standard. My wife and myself had diffent meals and we both thought it was poor. Also l am not a fan of the seat configuration. The storage areas are really good, however unless you are lying completely flat you are forced to sit on an uncomfortable angle to stretch your legs out.

title: "remains a reliable choice"
body: Not Verified | I recently flew on Singapore Airlines from Hong Kong to Singapore, and the experience was largely pleasant, reaffirming the airline’s reputation. Check-in at HKG was smooth, with efficient staff and minimal queues. Boarding was well-organized, adhering to priority groups, though the process felt slightly rushed due to a tight schedule. The A350-900 was clean and modern, with comfortable economy seats offering decent legroom. The cabin crew was attentive and polite, providing warm service throughout the flight. Noise levels were low, contributing to a relaxing journey. KrisWorld’s entertainment system had a great selection of movies and music. However, the touchscreen was occasionally sluggish. Meal service was a highlight, I opted for the seafood pasta, which was flavorful and well-presented. A small snack and beverages were also served, with a good variety of options. The flight departed on time and arrived early, which was impressive. Turbulence was minimal, and the captain provided clear updates. The only downside was the slightly cramped seating, which is typical for economy class on long-haul configured aircraft. While the seat space could be better, Singapore Airlines remains a reliable choice for this route. Would fly again for the service and punctuality!

title: "experience was very enjoyable"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Once I arrived at the check-in counter, a friendly smile greeted us. When I boarded the plane, I found that it was an old plane, but things inside were excellent. For instance, the seat was a bit narrow but I could comfortably sit. Cabin crew were polite. The food was delicious and a variety of drinks to choose from. There was not many movies to watch I linked to the WiFi. The experience was very enjoyable.

title: “It all came to an end too quickly”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Having last flown Singapore Airlines more than two decades ago, I was enthusiastic to fly again in their A350, albeit a short flight from Bangkok to Singapore. It began with a speedy Business Class check-in, with instructions to follow the signs to the SilverKris Lounge. Through Fast Track security, I headed towards the Gate 7 area, which was a fairly lengthy walk. Boarding was efficient. The first thing that impressed me was the gorgeous look of the cabin. It appeared in pristine condition. The cabin colour scheme of shades of mauve and light bluey-purple looked impeccable. Laid out in a 1x2x1 arrangement, this was a long-haul seating aircraft, operating on short-haul regional flights (sadly in Europe we have to contend with an 18-inch wide seat and 30-inch pitch, and no IFE). All the essential features of flatbed seating on this A350 were there. The seat functions on the side of the seat worked smoothly and effortlessly. A large pillow and blanket were placed on the seat. And on the side, was a small locker containing USB and power points, along with a menu and headphones. The pull-out mirror was a nice touch too. Preflight soft drinks came around, and requesting champagne, it was promptly served soon after. Just before pushback, hot towels were provided, and the safety video began with instructions to put on the 3-point seat belt (which has the shoulder strap). Once at cruising height, the breakfast service began. Being a short duration flight, the meal was served on a single tray. I was addressed by my name, and so opted for the Seafood Pad Thai, which came with prawns, scallops and fish cake - absolutely delicious. Without requesting, I was served with more champagne, followed by coffee. The touch-screen IFE worked well, and I noted a good selection of some of the very latest movies. I assumed that this was the same on all flights, as it wouldn't be possible to watch a 2-hour movie on a 2-hour flight. The headphones were a tad heavy and did not feel too comfortable. Overall, although the crew were non-engaging (short flight), the service was friendly and carried out with precision. It all came to an end too quickly, and I hope my next flight with Singapore Airlines will be a 'proper' long haul.

title: "below average pitch and recline"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Check in at Istanbul airport very fast and friendly with nine check in counters in operation. Boarding well organized. Both flights were on the quiet A359. Food and service on both flights decent, IFE ok, and WiFi rather mediocre. The seats are tight with a below average pitch and recline. Both flights on time.

title: "no dining on demand"
body: Not Verified | Changi Airport looking dated, but the SQ lounge was outstanding. Big working areas, excellent shower facilities, nice bar, plenty of good tasting food, spotlessly clean, good atmosphere. The business class seat lounging and sleeping positions are not comfortable, and the seat’s controls did not work quickly. Difficult to use power outlets, complicated storage areas, sleeping in a diagonal position with very small foothole. The IFE feels old with limited choice. No live TV. Worst deterioration when compared to their past offering, was the food & beverages. Limited choice, main course tasted bland, and premium drinks served in small soda-type glasses, no dining on demand. Luckily the complimentary wifi worked well.

title: "the screen of my seat was not working"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Brisbane to Singapore on flight SQ256. I had a bad experience during this flight. Because the screen of my seat was not working I informed the staff. He told me that there was nothing that could be done. He told me to share the screen with the person sitting next to me. How ridiculous! The unpleasant experience didn't end there. When it was time for the meal service, I was told that the food I ordered was no longer available. The staff said that there was only one option left. I expect better service and solutions from an airline, regardless of whether I'm flying business or economy class. We pay for the service, and it's reasonable to expect a certain level of quality and professionalism

title: "average in terms of comfort"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   Checkin at BKK very slow with a long line of passengers. It took me over an hour to reach the checkin counter. The station manager came, shrugged her shoulders and left. Flight itself on time and uneventful, food decent, although lukewarm. The long 13 hours flight was on the mighty and quiet A380. Flight left on time and arrived about an hour earlier than scheduled. Food was ok, but nothing to shout about. IFE and complimentary WiFi was very good. Seats average in terms of comfort and legroom.

title: “Always excellent service”
body: Not Verified | Excellent services as usual by Singapore Airlines from Darwin to Singapore on 13 March 2025, even though I was fasting and unable to eat my foods they didn’t forget to give me a box of dry foods and drinks to break my fasting. Thanks a lot to the cabin crews. Flight from Singapore to BKK SQ710 on 14 March was great too. Always excellent service.

title: "Everything is premium"
body: Not Verified | I recently flew in Singapore airlines. Everything about the airline is premium. Check in experience, the gate allotted to them, time performance, crew. Flying in A380 was itself unique experience. Seating comfort could have been better though, otherwise it's a 10 out of 10.

title: “disappointed on this trip”
body: Not Verified | Pretty disappointed on this trip on SQ. Initially from Seattle the entertainment system was not working for over an hour. Wifi on board even after I logged in with my Kris flyer ac could not connect. Flight attendant did try to help but she could not figure out. 2nd flight, SQ510 from SIN to BLR delayed over an 1 hour 45 mins.Just a series of frustrating experiences on SQ this time as I have traveled at least 4 to 5 times in last few years. Lots of my friends suggested Qatar which probably will be my next choice.

title: "best airline I've traveled with"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | This airline is world class and knows how to treat it's customers with professionalism and respect. Hands down, the best airline I've traveled with, (and I've traveled a lot). If their standards remain top notch, I'll be a customer for life.

title: “We didn’t ask for much"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | It was our honeymoon and this airline couldn’t care less. We didn’t ask for much but the rudeness of their online staff really took away from the experience. Very disappointing approach from what I thought was a reputable organisation.

title: "All I got were apologies"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I did the automatic 48-hr online check-in. We arrived at LHR Terminal 2 early at around 0615, and our flight was scheduled 0910 (LHR- SIN-MNL). Upon arrival in the departure area, we found out, through airport personnel that our flight is delayed due to late arrival of the incoming plane. Very tired we were instructed to join a long queue and stood there for about 30 minutes, just near the gate of the Term 2. Few minutes later, we were instructed (again) to join another queue and stood there for another 20 minutes. To make the story short, we boarded the late aircraft. Adding to the bad experience, my paid seat did not adjust but stuck to its upright position. Singapore Airlines is a great airline. I used them before. I flew with them last Oct 2024 on same route. All I got were apologies. I am sad but surely I will try to avoid SA in future.

title: "thoughtful, polite and lovely stewardess"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | It makes my day to be served by caring, thoughtful, polite and lovely stewardess that hard to come by as far as SQ is concerned serving own homeland. A great applaud to Natalie. For the moment we step into the plane and settle down, this lady greet us with broad smile. I am so grateful of her coming to my rescue to help me ease my gastric by going the extra mile to get me biscuits and hot drinks when they are busy out of their normal routine and SOP. Caring enough to come by to check on me that Im well. When we ask for drinks that help to soothe my daughter vomiting, other staff just cant help and said they cant do anything. Here come our hero Natalie, whom with her sincere thoughtfulness and care to fetch my daughter a hot peppermint tea which is not serve in economy class. Hopefully, the next round, I will meet her again . She deserve to be the one wearing green uniform . Well done Natalie! You are a role model for rest to follow.

title: "The product has changed"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My first time on SQ since before the pandemic and was looking forward to it. The product has changed however and not for the better. The meal has no menu (WiFi version didn’t work) and there are no branded products on the tray. Alcohol is available but only on request. Drinks are served without snacks or a napkin. Mid flight snacks are available. IFE is poor compared to other premium carriers. Crew were immaculate and excellent as always. Good VFM ticket too.

title: "did everything to support me after that"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I want to acknowledge the excellent service and hard work of the flying crew who are amongst the best that I have flown with. However as a wheel chair passenger I have to flag the fact that whereas Malpensa Airport ground assistance was excellent at Changi airport for the second year in a row I was dumped outside the boarding gate by the ground assistance staff and left to flag down a passing attendant to get help to get into the boarding gate. Assistance had been requested on all sectors to the plane entrance. The guy who dropped me off outside the gate said he would contact staff to help me to the plane which he either never did or they failed to respond. Subsequent confusion and physical stress at the security check in despite a visible tag indicating my assistance required status. The ticket officer was not very understanding and seemed to imply that there was no problem since I had made it. The cabin crew supervisor did everything to support me after that and as I said I have no complaints about the quality of the flight staff and their service on board on both sectors.

title: “Outstanding service”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Outstanding service from the cabin crew, who made passengers feel welcome with every interaction throughout the flight. They have been very well trained in hospitality. Food and beverages were plentiful and tasty, and passengers were free to get snacks from the galley (even in economy class) in between the 2 main meals served. The range of options for movies was impressive. I would go out of my way to choose this airline in the future, even if it meant paying more compared to a competitor.

title: "prioritizing paid seat selection"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I took a SIA flight from SG to Hanoi with my wife and Son on the 15 Dec. It was very disappointing that we found out that my son was seated few rows behind us when there are 4 empty seats in front of me and my wife. It happened again on our return trip SIA is prioritizing paid seat selection. I don't think I will fly with SIA anymore

title: "Perfect service from the cabin crew"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Perfect service from the cabin crew, even in economy class. With a full flight they still managed to maintain a high standard of attentiveness. Ample food provided. WiFi didn’t work for the full duration of the flight however.

title: “Truly service, elevated”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Truly service, elevated. Almost every step of the way, the customer and service were at the forefront. I won't comment much about the food, but it was acceptable. Cleanliness was also prioritised. The real gems are the well trained crew all around. From ticketing to ground to sky. For such a huge airline there are bound to be misses but most are above average and class leading, and this is something other airlines would struggle to achieve. Well done and they deserve all the accommodates for the work the management has put into making the airlines experience an elevated one.

title: "did not exceed my expectation"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My first time with Singapore Airlines did not exceed my expectation. The aircraft they use on our flight from Auckland is old. The lavatory was not well maintained. Some of the cabin crew are also disappointing.

title: "Cabin crew were so attentive"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   Singapore Airlines did a great job on a very full flight. Cabin crew were so attentive. Constantly coming up and down to offer drinks etc. Even a hot towel half-way through. I often fly with Qatar and there’s very little to choose between the two. They are without a doubt the two best airlines in the world, a significant level higher than the rest of the pack.

title: "not easily able to access the bathroom"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My daughter and I flew Singapore Airlines on our trip to Khao Lak in Thailand. We decided to go for what we thought was a reputable airline so we could have an enjoyable journey. We booked early and selected our seats, as we both had mild anxiety and medical conditions which necessitated a seat near the bathrooms. On our return flight there was a delay with flights which resulted in missing our flight from Singapore to Melbourne. We were placed on the next available flight, which was about 3 hours later. There were about 60 people in the same situation I was told, so there was a lot of chaos in getting new boarding passes, etc. We had no say in the seats which we placed in and of course they ended up being in the middle seat of the middle aisle. My daughter was extremely stressed as she was placed between two elderly people with mobility issues, and was not easily able to access the bathroom. The flight was initially very hot until they eventually managed to adjust the air conditioning. We were entitled to have an evening meal, but the only food we received was a pizza slice and breakfast. We ended up paying for a service which we didn't receive. I did write to Singapore Airlines and received the usual spiel about caring about customers

title: "a pleasure to fly with"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | A pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines. Newer airplanes, best services, perfect entertainment system with plenty of choices, newest cabin. Flight crew the most professional and adorable.

title: "in-flight service was top-notch"
body: Not Verified | The best airline I have ever traveled with. The entire experience was fantastic. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, and the flight was smooth and comfortable. The plane was clean and well-maintained, and the in-flight service was top-notch. I have no complaints, only great memories.

title: "might receive complaints from other passengers"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | 2 adults and 1 toddler travelling. We redeemed 2 business ticket via miles for wife and kid at full adult cost and an adult economy due to limited seats available. My spouse is heavily pregnant. They wouldn't even let me sit with my 2.5 year old to help my family though I clearly explained that I wouldn't need any business class meal or service. The flight staff's excuse was that they might receive complaints from other passengers.

title: "Only two meals served"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Worst airline food service. Only two meals served in a 17 hour flight and no snacks in between. For the second meal they ran out of vegetarian meal and only offered fruit. And when I expressed disappointment, they gave me a vegetarian meal. Secondly, they played an elevator music for one full hour during landing.

title: "one of our most enjoyable flights"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | We flew Singapore Air;ine (SIA) for the first time. The checkin and boarding was very smooth. The seat was quite large and comfortable. The cabin crew were very nice and friendly. The food on BKK-Singapore route was quite tasty and on Singapore -Seoul route was excellent. They provided Free WiFi on both route wghich make us very happy. The entertainment (Movie, TV and Music) was great. This was one of our most enjoyable flights.

title: "Excellent for economy"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Excellent for economy. Five hours into flight and the seat was still comfortable - soft and firm in the right spots. The breakfast was good for economy. Large enough portions. Taste enough with variation on the tray to add interest. Cabin staff outstanding. Friendly and attentive. Quality tv screen. Easy to operate with a wide variety of programs. My transmitter that enables my wireless headphones to connect, doesn't always work on left and right. No problems on this flight. Power outlets for mains and USB. The best boarding process I have used, why don't all airlines do this? After showing boarding pass and entering the gate lounge, we were seated in boarding groups. Then each seated are group was called up in turn. Much more efficient than calling out the number of the boarding group and hoping every one has heard and no one tries to queue jump.

title: "dismissive and unapologetic tone"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My sister made an error in the booking, and I called the airline to see if I could change the return destination. After providing the necessary booking details for verification, the representative asked for the email associated with the ticket. When I explained that I couldn’t find it, the response I received was surprisingly abrupt and unprofessional: "That’s not my question." The tone was far from what one would expect from a customer service agent tasked with assisting passengers. The conversation continued with the agent asking if I was authorized to make changes to the booking. I explained that my sister had asked me to call, and I was met with an impatient demand for a "YES or NO" answer, with no effort to seek proof or confirmation of my authorization. Once I responded affirmatively, I was informed that the ticket could not be changed from the original destination, and no alternative options or further assistance were offered. The interaction left me with the distinct impression that providing help or exploring solutions was not a priority. The dismissive and unapologetic tone from the representative was disheartening, especially considering the airline’s reputation for excellence. I understand that policies around ticket changes are firm, but the lack of courtesy and helpfulness in communicating this was disappointing. It’s unfortunate to see a disconnect between the airline's esteemed reputation and the actual service provided.

title: “Moon Festival Treats were a nice touch”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ22 Solo Seat. Boards on Changi didn’t have the flight listed for awhile. Had to wait. Made it to the gate, which opened on time. Boarding commenced. Crew friendly, and warm. No bottled water in the water holder. Took off on time. Fell asleep when the First meal came out, and crew woke me up. Noticed they had put my window shades down. Champagne was served in a Glass. They ran out of food, and I had to have the Shrimp option. Was good, and the Moon Festival Treats were a nice touch. No second round of drinks. One Lavatory was a disaster and a broken sink. Second meal came out, this time Champagne was in a Plastic Cup. Snacks, and sandwiches were left out. Arriving in to EWR early, with the Luggage Carousel not working. Can’t wait for the next SQ21/23 trip!

title: “Little touches are always nice”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ191 HAN-SIN in Economy. Staff at SQ HAN counter friendly, polite, and warm. Was verified that I checked in online, quickly received boarding pass, and luggage checked in. Gate area seemed that there was not enough seating. Incoming aircraft arrived late, with no notice/announcements. Boarding Announcements were made, and orderly Started boarding. Crew at the door politely greeted me, and commented on my Rimowa Attaché. Little touches are always nice. Crew did a good job seating everyone. Pushed back, and took off. Served a meal, options available. Crew continued presence, and strong service. Cabin prepared for arrival, and Landed into Changi T3.

title: "warm, vibrant, energetic, and friendly"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ192 in Economy. Gate area was roped off, with traffic going around. Don’t know why, cause as early as 0600 the Information said SQ192. Gate opened extremely late. Ticket quickly verified, and boarded. Was escorted to my seat. Crew warm, vibrant, energetic, and friendly. Short Taxi out, close to runway, and took off. Had a small meal, which was nice touch for a Regional Flight. Landed early in HAN, and I wished a Trainee Cabin Attendant best of luck on Qualifying. Debarking, There was no direction to the Luggage Carousel, no information on it, and no ground staff present. Once again SQ Needs to be training their ground staff, to get better.

title: "The staff were excellent"
body: Not Verified | First time on Premium economy and with Singapore for some considerable time. We were travelling from Syd via Singapore to NYC. We had a 12 hr stop (air side) in the Aerotel at Changi between flights. The flight from Syd left pretty much on time on SA's A350-900 for the 8hr trip. Premium economy is set up 2 x 4 x 2 and we had seats 32A and 32C for this leg on the left side of the aircraft. The in flight service was pretty much as we would have expected and hoped for - excellent. We were provided with hot towel before a small glass of sparkling wine (new for us). The seating was a step up from economy being slightly wider and with the increased pitch and recline (plenty of YouTube reviews of this). The trays were stowed in the centre partition between the seats that prevented this from being used as might with an economy seat - but wasn't an issue. We took advantage of the Book the Cook option for meal selection, which was quite extensive (but not available for all services). This meant stewards checked and confirmed our orders and we were served early. The food was overall very good on this flight and they provide you with a full meal service, that is individual small salad, separate mains, dessert, condiments, full steel cutlery, ceramic or porcelain dishes, water, cloth napkins and tray liner. Could not complain and food quality was very good. Qantas could learn a thing or three from SA regarding full carrier meals services as their standards have dropped significantly in recent years to a single one dish type of offering. (at least in their economy class) Additional drinks including tea/coffee, wine, beer or spirits were service just after meals were delivered and on request throughout the flight. Some additional snacks were available from the galley or on request. Most importantly the flight was smooth and seamless as was the on time and safe landing at Changi. It was a bit of a treat having experienced Premium economy and would recommend trying this if able to do so particularly for longer flights. We found the 8+ hrs to Singapore wasn't to much to manage in economy. However of our 4 flights despite being great was probably 4th in overall comfort and experience. Flight 2 - SQ024 - Singapore to NYC - A350-900 We had the 18+ hr flight from Changi to JFK in NYC coming up (which is currently the longest commercially operated flight). This flight only caters for 2 seating classes, Business and Premium economy there is no economy available on this flight due to logistical considerations and overall much less passenger load. We were seated in 39A and 39C for the flight. Again departure was pretty much on time and we set off on this epic journey. The staff were excellent and again we had opted for the Book the Cook menu selection for some of our meals. We were very fortunate with this flight path that passed over Alaska/north pole region and had fantastic views over the upper Rocky Mountains and skirted by Mt McKinley (highest peak in N. America). The 18+ hours passed relatively easily and Singapore Airlines on board entertainment suite provided ample selection to keep you amused. Additional drinks etc were offered throughout the flight. JFK arrival late afternoon/early evening was on time.

title: "It’s a serious pleasure"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | SQ23 in Premium Economy. Booked in May, no Solo Seat available. Check in at JFK was extremely efficient, and controlled, even with the new machines. Staff friendly. At the gate, announcements were terrible. Seemed like agent wasn’t used to speaking on the announcement system. Boarding was delayed because of? Upon boarding aircraft was rather cold. A few passengers complained, and the crew explained “it’s central controlled A/C”. Took off late. Steward came by with Bottled Water. Throughout the flight aircraft was freezing, and I had to use a blanket. First drink run I had Champagne, but plastic glasses used. Served first meal, and had 2 options. I had the Thai Curry Beef, really tasty. Constant drink runs commenced. I dozed off, waking up to a snack. Crew were friendly with snacks, offering drinks and sandwiches. Second meal was served. I ordered the Shrimp, but got Cheese Omelette. Engaged the staff, and they replaced it. Constant drink rounds, with snack sandwiches at the back, and a Flatbread Pizza finally. Crew prepared us for arrival, extremely professionally, and assisting as needed. Landed before 0500, yet departed over 30 minutes late. It’s a serious pleasure to be SQ21, and SQ23.

title: "definitely enjoyed the flight"
body: Not Verified | It was actually my first time going to Auckland in a A350. My Sister's TV screen was not working and they immediately fixed it. This is what I call efficiency. When we took off, about half and hour later, the cabin crew started breakfast service. I chose the nasi lemak and orange jucie. Very good! Only downside was that it was supposed to be fried chicken but the chicken was breast meat. But I don't blame them for that. Cabin crew were extremely friendly. Food was very very good too. I definitely enjoyed the flight.

title: "consistently high quality"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Singapore Airlines continues to provide consistently high quality on-board service. Cabin crew are always polite, friendly, helpful and professional. Seat design varies according to aircraft type and route. Some work better than others. Lounge quality varies - especially when not operated by Singapore Airlines. Food and beverage quality, choice and delivery remain a very high standard. Cabin service runs like clockwork and team co-operation works well and this shows. IFE was excellent. Priority tags sometimes don't work in that priority baggage arrives anytime - not always first.

title: "ground service was appalling
body: ✅ Trip Verified | The ground service was appalling. Singapore Airlines does not seem to have much of a presence in Dubai anymore and DNATA handles everything. To say that the check-in counter staff was inefficient and ignorant would be an understatement. She did not even know that Scoot Airlines is a partner of SQ and had no clue about which terminal it operates, and worse still she gave the wrong information. In-flight service and food were excellent as usual but on arrival, the ground staff were again inefficient. IFE was outstanding and the free wifi was well appreciated. SQ has a weird policy of not providing amenities and will only offer it if asked for.

title: "they are unable to compensate me"
body: Not Verified | I have flown SQ for years and also reached Solitaire status with them for the last few years. Generally, I have always been happy with their service until I encountered a problem. My recent experience with them on a flight from Sydney to Singapore was more than disappointing. The flight was supposed to leave at 11:00 am. However, when I arrived at the airport at 9:00 am I was told that there might be some delays due to technical problems. When I finished immigration and security, I was made aware that the flight was delayed to after 6:00 pm. No one from Singapore Airlines was available to talk to as I was looking to leave the airport and go back to the city instead of waiting the whole day at the airport. Unfortunately, the lounge was also closed due to renovation works. Luckily, we could use the Air New Zealand Lounge and employees there kept promising us that a SQ staff would come and talk to us in 10-15 minutes. In any way, they said that there will be an announcement when the SQ staff would arrive. Well, the staff never showed up until a couple of hours later and there was also never an announcement. Since SQ also just sent one rep, the queue was quite massive. While waiting in the queue a rep called me (I assume that happened because of my high tier status) and offered that I could rebook to the 3 pm flight but they would need to downgrade me to economy class. After asking them about the fare difference, they confirmed that the far difference will be compensated in cash later. I therefore accepted the rebooking. At the time when I was boarding the plane and they were scanning my ticket, they were suddenly asking me to sign a letter. After asking about the content of the letter, they told me that they would compensate me $400 but I would drop any further claims. I told them that I would not sign a letter I have never read while a queue is standing behind me and proceeded to board the plane. Since, I have not heard from them since that day, I was following up on my compensation. Their response is that they are unable to compensate me and said they would give me 20,000 KrisFlyer miles instead. I did enjoy flying with SQ in the past and their cabin crew is second to none. However, dealing with SQ corporate when there is a problem is something I would like to avoid in the future. So I have decided to change airlines once i used all my miles.

title: "I had an amazing experience"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | This was my first time for me to travel with Singapore Airlines. I had an amazing experience, food was wow and customer service excellent, very neat and tidy well organized. I will recommend to my Aussie kiwi and Fiji friends.

title: “meal was not provided”
body: Not Verified | I am writing this review for the muslim meal preference, I requested for the muslim meal but meal was not provided, they said we have not booked, but we had booked, it was really sad, I didn't expect this from Singapore, first time it has happened to me. Really disappointed, they said it was not booked, but my agent rechecked it and it was done

title: "amazing cabin crew"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My flight from London to Singapore on the 18th was delayed by about an hour. I was worried about making my connection to Tokyo and asked the cabin crew how best to proceed when I arrived in Singapore. They told me not to worry as ground staff would be there to assist. When I arrived in Singapore, the only assistance was ground staff saying 'Tokyo flight that way' and pointing. I ended up having to sprint through the airport (a very long way) and only just made my connecting flight. Either ground staff should have said that it was not possible to make the flight or they should have had transportation ready to get me to the gate quickly. Singapore Airlines made no effort to help me make the tight connection. As it was, my bags were unable to make it. This caused more inconvenience when I landed at Tokyo. Singapore Airlines ground staff were not very helpful. There were people around the baggage carousel to help me arrange delivery of my bags. However, the best that they could do was to offer to deliver the bags in two days. I said to the ground staff that if they couldn't deliver the bags for two days, could they provide me money to buy these essentials. They point-blank refused. I therefore insisted that the bags be delivered sooner. It was a real battle to get this sorted out and took almost an hour. This was after more than 30 hours after leaving my home in the UK. The ground staff seemed to have zero understanding of the fact that I was tired. They also kept offering to deliver the bags at times that I would be at work. It seemed a case of me having to work around their schedule rather than them having to work around mine. This whole lack of consideration for what was convenient for me after having had my bags delayed through no fault of my own, just added insult to injury. The airline also gave me a meal with fish in on the Tokyo to Singapore flight despite the fact that I had ordered a vegetarian meal. They did apologise profusely for this and gave me compensation in the form of a voucher. Singapore Airlines have amazing cabin crew. On all four flights, they went above and beyond to assist and ensure that I had a good journey. However, I feel like the airline is depending upon the excellent service/attitude of the cabin crew and that the rest of the airline's services leave a lot to be desired. The ground staff in particular were extremely unhelpful and seemed like they really were not interested in the customers. The check-in staff at London Gatwick were extremely unfriendly and rude. I expect good service all round from an airline not just when I am in the air. While I love the in-flight service with Singapore Airlines, I would seriously consider whether to fly with them again due to the very poor service/attitude that the ground staff seem to have. A five-star airline (which has been voted the best airline in the world on several occasions) should have more to offer than simply excellent cabin crew.

title: "wheel chair, I did not understand the logic"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Family of three travelled from Kochi to Singapore on 15/8/2024. While we arrived at the boarding gate at there was more than 12 wheel chair bound passengers queueing in the Economy Class and Business Class lane. We were waiting in the business class queue to board when the female staff boarded 5 Economy class passengers. When queried she informed us that they are accompanying a passenger on wheel chair, I did not understand the logic in 5 persons helping one passenger on wheel chair. The process was a chaos and mis-managed. We had to wait on the ramp leading to the airplane door for more than 20 minutes.

title: "worst if not the worst flight on SQ"
body: Not Verified | One of the worst if not the worst flight on SQ. Boarded last walked to my seat. FA was talking to the passenger seated in front of my seat. She acknowledged me and I sat down. No offer of pre takeoff drinks or hot towel. Same FA came to me and confirmed my meal order and said lunch would be served at 12pm. Flight was a day flight taking off at 9am. After takeoff again no after takeoff drink/nuts offered. Lights dimmed. Lunch was to be served around 1130am. So for 2 1/2 hours I did not see any FAs in the cabin. Nothing offered during that time. This is in Business Class mind you. Lunch service was the usual standard but honestly the crew were mediocre. Not to mention never saw the Inflight Manager the whole flight except just prior to landing. The seat was the regional type and I hate it. It's too cramped and uncomfortable. SQ your service has really gone down the hill. What has happened to the famous "inflight service even other airlines talk about"? Very sad to see such a great airline before go down the drain.

title: "truly outstanding"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   My recent flight with Singapore Airlines was truly outstanding. From the smooth check-in process to the comfortable and well-maintained cabin, every aspect of the journey was exceptional. The in-flight entertainment options were extensive, and the meals were delicious and well-presented. A special thank you to Nur Atisah, whose remarkable service and warm demeanor made the flight even more enjoyable. Her attentiveness and care exemplify the high standards of Singapore Airlines and significantly enhanced my travel experience. Overall, Singapore Airlines delivers a superior flying experience, and I highly recommend them for anyone seeking comfort and exceptional service.

title: "Could not ask for better service"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Could not ask for better service. Went out of there way to help as my wife is in a wheelchair no matter what we asked for was no trouble. Even got chair as she could not walk to toilet. Thank you very mutch

title: "rude and disrespectful"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Just arrived today Jul 31 with SQ892. Flight full, Krisworld connection Wi-fi Inconsistent. Trio Flight attendant serving my row 67A is rude and disrespectful and showing impatient attitude when asking for more drinks and keep gossip nearby galley. Heavy rain and hard landing at 25R at 1345 and long 18 mins taxi docked at gate 5 at 1403.

title: “mismanaged, irresponsible”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | I took a flight from Bangkok to Tokyo via Singapore and was told that one of my luggages could not be placed on the flight from Singapore to Tokyo. The ground staff in Tokyo explained that it was because the flight I chose had a short connection time. No, no, no, this flight was recommended by Singapore Airlines when I made the reservation, rather than my choice. She said the package was late because I chose it? I have never heard such a nonsensical shifting of responsibility before. Moreover, the ground staff explained that Singapore Airlines is not responsible for checked baggage and that this was agreed upon at the time of booking. Well, this is what I call an irresponsible handling. She further explained that the package would not arrive at my place only after 2 days. In Japan, logistics is so advanced that it is normal for a package to arrive on the same day as the shipping date if it is in Tokyo. When I pointed this out, they finally arranged for same day delivery after a 30 minute wait. In other words, it was Singapore Airlines' fault, but they would not make the best arrangements unless we told them. However, the next day I received another call. They don't know why, but I was told that my luggage was not loaded on the scheduled flight at Changi Airport again and did not arrive in Tokyo the next day. Will my package ever be delivered? I have found this company to be mismanaged, irresponsible, and responsible without any shame. Please be careful, everyone.

title: "quickly processed a full refund"
body: Not Verified | I recently had to cancel my booking with Singapore Airlines due to an urgent medical situation in my family. The customer service team was incredibly understanding and compassionate throughout the process. They quickly processed a full refund, which significantly eased our stress during this difficult time. I am extremely grateful for their professionalism and support. Thank you, Singapore Airlines, for your exceptional service and empathy.

title: "prevented me from logging in to my account"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | As part of my student privileges I get 1 free change which they caused unnecessary delays of over 2 weeks to help me with. They have been asking personal information and the exact same documents repeatedly with me talking to different representatives over the same thing again and again. They will act like they want to help but will actually provide no transparency and will only waste your time. In fact, their technical team prevented me from logging in to my account and magically on making a complaint and sending them screenshots of reduced fares, they responded and took 2 weeks more to let me login to my account. Their actions need to be reported.

title: "No compensation"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Singapore Airlines quality has declined significantly over the years. I used to fly regularly but stopped taking it for a while until yesterday on a long haul flight from Houston. Food and beverage - Just above average. Beef bourguignon was overcooked and not tender. Chicken Tikka lacks flavor. Poor wine selection. Only one that was really good was the singaporean crab cake. Premium economy lacks leg room vs others. Pillow case is old and faded in color. Some parts of seat sides not cleaned properly. Entertainment Behind vs others. Live TV doesn’t work. Lacks in brightness and sharpness. Lack of TV series options. Worst, it was down the whole 24 hrs flight during my wife and kids travel on June 18th. They gave compensation vouchers but only for inflight shopping which lacks necessary / useful items. Wifi onboard while it’s free it lacks the speed. Amenities did not get any. Not even eye mask, tooth brush. Cabin crew no longer the proud “singapore hospitality” it once was. Some friendly and attentive, some others just wanting to get the flight over and go home. One even mistook connecting headphone to headphone jack as phone charging so she forced me to take it off during landing and when she realize she was wrong did not say sorry. During my flight from Houston on July 5th I suddenly received notice that baggage is transferred to another flight. While it’s good they notified early and they delivered to my holiday accommodation, had to wait for 8 hours without clothing and basic necessities and ended up doing last minute shopping. They acted as if it’s a normal situation. No compensation. Punctuality I have to say they still excel in this area (hence the two star). It seems likely that SQ has exercised significant budget cuts post covid to increase profitability. However, price is still high vs others so it’s time to take a reflection.

title: “A fantastic flight!”
body: Not Verified | A fantastic flight! Crew made me feel very comfortable from the first moment I entered the plane. The food was excellent, very tasty and refined and the wine selection was amazing. Thank you so much for making such a long flight a great experience!

title: “the best customer service”
body: ✅ Trip Verified | My wife and I flew Singapore Airlines from Frankfurt to Jakarta with stop over in Singapore on SQ25, and SQ964. I just want to commend all the cabin crews on both flights, they are such a dedicated crews and very professional. I ranked them as the best customer service in any airlines that I have flown before. The plane is a bit worn but they have maintained their interior, seats are comfortable, and is spotless. The inflight entertainments needs an upgrade, and meals were a bit degraded from the previous experienced with them, but I truly enjoyed flying with Singapore airlines for their friendly and top of the notch customer service.

title: "SIA can do much better than this"
body: ✅ Trip Verified | Could not be more opposite to my previous flight. New A350 but very, very untidy. Cabin crew had no consideration for passengers, only came around once. I know it's a short flight, but I also know that SIA can do much better than this. Despite this, I will continue to use SIA.

title: "a very pleasant flight"
body: ✅ Trip Verified |   Had a very pleasant flight on a 787. Very attentive and polite staff despite the fact it was a "red eye" flight out of Perth. Awesome staff, well done. Flight was 20 minutes early. When I tried to register my Kris flyer points on board the aircraft it kept telling me that my membership number was invalid. I will follow this up with SIA in the near future.

title: "experience was quite remarkable"
